title: Ticket #1381: PCRE compilation issues in "proper" mode
description:
Brian Bockelman submitted the following to condor-admin:

I noticed that there appears to be no way to compile 7.5.1 in "proper" mode. This is apparently because the new ClassAd library depends on PCRE, and "-lpcre" is not added to the linking set if proper mode is set (or --without-externals is thrown).

The patch below fixes the autoconf file to do two things:

  1. If externals are on, but no external for PCRE is set, it will try to take it from the build environment.
  2. If externals are off, take PCRE from the build environment.

Using the patch below, I can compile even on the latest Fedora with this command

./configure --disable-gcc-version-check --disable-glibc-version-check --disable-static --without-externals

(Some hand-hacking remains to get vm-gahp to not be enabled in proper mode; --without-libvirt is apparently not strong enough, and the version of libvirt in the latest Fedora does not appear to be compatible with vm-gahp. I'm sure someone else will tackle this.)

Brian 

diff --git a/src/configure.ac b/src/configure.ac
index d52eac0..5c1b558 100644
--- a/src/configure.ac
+++ b/src/configure.ac
@@ -3075,11 +3075,16 @@ fi
 CHECK_EXTERNAL([pcre], [7.6], [hard],
                [use PCRE (provides regular expression support)],
                MF_LIB_CHECK([pcre], [[pcre pcre_compile]], [PCRE]))
+
 AS_IF([test "x$cv_ext_pcre" = xyes],
   [CPPFLAGS_save="$CPPFLAGS"
    CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS $PCRE_CFLAGS"
    AC_CHECK_HEADERS([pcre.h pcre/pcre.h])
-   CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS_save"])
+   CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS_save"]
+  [AC_CHECK_HEADERS([pcre.h], [], [AC_MSG_ERROR([PCRE headers not found or incompatible])])
+   AC_CHECK_LIB([pcre], [pcre_study], [HAVE_PCRE="yes"; PCRE_LDFLAGS="$PCRE_LDFLAGS -lpcre"], [AC_MSG_ERROR([PCRE library not found or incompatible ])])
+  ]
+)
 AC_SUBST(PCRE_LDFLAGS, $PCRE_LDFLAGS)
 AC_SUBST(PCRE_CFLAGS, $PCRE_CFLAGS)

@@ -3333,6 +3338,11 @@ else
   AC_SUBST(want_ext_glibc,NO)
   AC_SUBST(ext_glibc_version,UNUSED)

+# We still need PCRE, even if we're not using externals, due to ClassAd library
+  AC_CHECK_HEADERS([pcre.h], [], [AC_MSG_ERROR([PCRE headers not found or incompatible])])
+  AC_CHECK_LIB([pcre], [pcre_study], [HAVE_PCRE="yes"; PCRE_LDFLAGS="$PCRE_LDFLAGS -lpcre"], [AC_MSG_ERROR([PCRE library not found or incompatible ])])
+  AC_SUBST(PCRE_LDFLAGS, $PCRE_LDFLAGS)
+
 fi
 # END of if $ac_cv_has_externals = "YES" or $enable_proper = yes
